entities.description: "Super Mario Land is identified as a parent entity in the process of selecting a fact to render, specifically related to the Publisher relation."
"Nintendo is chosen as the entity to render due to the Publisher relation with Super Mario Land, indicating a business connection."
"$\kappa g_{<t}$ represents a subset of the knowledge graph up to time $t$, containing entities and relations used for reference."
"$\mathcal{E}$ is the set of all entities in the knowledge graph, from which upcoming entities are chosen."
"$\mathcal{E}_{<t}$ represents the set of entities known up to time $t$, used for choosing parent entities and relations."
"$\mathcal{K}\mathcal{G}_{<t}$ is the knowledge graph up to time $t$, containing factual relations between entities."
"$e_{t}$ represents the upcoming entity to be chosen from the set of all entities $\mathcal{E}$, based on the model's conditions."
"$p_{t}$ is the parent entity chosen from $\mathcal{E}_{<t}$, used in the process of rendering factual relations."
"$r_{t}$ represents the factual relation chosen from $\mathcal{K}\mathcal{G}_{<t}$, connecting a parent entity to a tail entity."
"$x_{t}$ is the token generated by the model, conditioned on the chosen entity $e_{t}$, potentially using one of $e_{t}$'s aliases."
"$\mathcal{E}_{<(t+1)}$ represents the updated set of entities after incorporating the new entity $e_{t}$, if it was not previously known."
"Reflexive relation is a self-relating entity connection, where $p=e$ for $(p,R e f l e x i v e,e)$, used for the model to refer to an entity it has already mentioned."

relationships.description: "Super Mario Land and Nintendo are related through the Publisher relation, indicating that Nintendo publishes Super Mario Land."
"$\kappa g_{<t}$ and $\mathcal{E}_{<t}$ are related as $\mathcal{E}_{<t}$ contains entities from the subset of the knowledge graph $\kappa g_{<t}$."
"$\mathcal{E}_{<t}$ and $\mathcal{K}\mathcal{G}_{<t}$ are related as $\mathcal{E}_{<t}$ contains entities and $\mathcal{K}\mathcal{G}_{<t}$ contains relations between these entities."
"$e_{t}$ is chosen from the set of all entities $\mathcal{E}$, indicating a selection relationship."
"$p_{t}$ is chosen from the set of entities $\mathcal{E}_{<t}$, indicating a selection relationship."

entities.description: "UNK refers to tokens that are mapped to an unknown category in language modeling."
"$\mathcal{U}$ represents the set of tokens that get mapped to UNK in the context of language modeling."
"UPP stands for Unigram Perplexity and is a measure used in language modeling to assess the performance of models."

Linked WikiText-2 is a dataset that links articles from the WikiText-2 language modeling corpus to the Wikidata knowledge graph, providing a resource for training language models that incorporate factual knowledge from a knowledge graph.
"ENTITYNLM is an entity-based language model that improves the ability to track entities by jointly modeling named entity recognition and coreference."
"EntityCopyNet is an entity-based language model mentioned in the context of evaluating model perplexities."
"KGLM is a knowledge graph-based language model that leverages knowledge graphs for accurate language modeling and outperforms other models in perplexity."
"AWDLSTM is a model that was outperformed by KGLM variants, producing generic, common words instead of accurate facts."
"NEL KGLM is a variant of KGLM that uses a discriminative model combined with an NEL entity linker to produce entity annotations."
"GPT-2 is a state-of-the-art language model trained on a large corpus, used for comparison with KGLM in terms of fact completion."
"Freebase is a database from which popular relations are selected for the evaluation of language models' ability to complete sentences with factual information."
"WebText is a large corpus used for training the GPT-2 model, which contains over 8 million documents."
"Barack Obama is used as an example in the text to demonstrate the effect of changing facts in the knowledge graph on model predictions."
"Table 3 presents the model perplexities, showing KGLM's lower perplexity compared to other models."
"Table 4 shows the performance of language models on fact completion, with KGLM outperforming others."
"Table 5 provides examples of fact completion by KGLM and GPT-2, highlighting the specificity of KGLM's predictions."
"Importance sampling is an approach used to estimate perplexities for entity-based language models."
"Factual text generation is the primary objective of the language models being evaluated."
"$X$ is a placeholder used in the completion templates for entities whose relations are being evaluated."
"$Y$ is a placeholder used in the completion templates for entities related to $X$ in the evaluated relations."
"Oracle KGLM is a variant of KGLM that is given the correct entity annotation for $X$."
"Radford et al., 2019 refers to the authors of the GPT-2 model, which is trained on a large corpus and compared with KGLM."
"NKLM, or neural knowledge language model, is an existing knowledge-based language model that inspired the development of KGLM."
"Ji et al., 2017 refers to the authors of ENTITYNLM, a knowledge-based language model that improves entity tracking."
"Ahn et al., 2016 refers to the authors of NKLM, a neural knowledge language model that inspired the work on KGLM."

relationships.description: "UNK tokens are mapped to the set $\mathcal{U}$, which affects the computation of UPP in language modeling."
"KGLM and ENTITYNLM are both entity-based language models, but KGLM leverages knowledge graphs and outperforms ENTITYNLM in perplexity."
"KGLM is compared with EntityCopyNet in terms of model perplexities, showing substantially lower perplexity for KGLM."
"KGLM variants significantly outperform AWDLSTM in producing accurate facts."
"KGLM is compared with GPT-2 for fact completion, with KGLM producing more specific tokens, while GPT-2 tends to produce more generic tokens."
"NEL KGLM outperforms AWDLSTM by producing accurate entity annotations for $X$, unlike AWDLSTM."
"Importance sampling is the method used to estimate perplexities presented in Table 3."
"Table 4 evaluates the ability of language models to complete sentences with factual information, which is the primary objective of factual text generation."
"The relationship between $X$ and $Y$ is evaluated in the completion templates for factual text generation."
"Oracle KGLM and NEL KGLM are compared in their ability to produce entity annotations for $X$."
"KGLM draws inspiration from NKLM and improves upon it by modeling entity linking and relation extraction."
"ENTITYNLM and NKLM are both knowledge-based language models that inspired the development of KGLM."

entities.description: "Wikidata is a free, collaborative, multilingual, secondary database, collecting structured data to provide a common source for data in Wikipedia, Wikimedia Commons, and other Wikimedia projects."
"Game Boy is a handheld game console manufactured by Nintendo, which serves as a platform for various games including Super Mario Land."
"Super Mario Land is a platform video game developed and published by Nintendo for the Game Boy platform."
"Nintendo is a Japanese multinational consumer electronics and video game company that developed the Game Boy and published Super Mario Land."

"TransE is a model used for learning embeddings of entities and relations, mentioned in the context of pre-trained KG embeddings."

"WikiText-2 is a dataset used for training language models, which was collected by querying the Wikipedia Text API."

"The string matching process is a method used in the text to link entities and dates, such as linking '1989' to 04-21-1989."
"The pint library in Python is used in the text to handle different ways of expressing units for quantities."
"Entity tokens are factual references to information in the knowledge graph, mentioned as more than 10% of the tokens in the Linked WikiText-2 corpus."
"$\gamma$ represents the margin in the max-margin loss function used to learn the embeddings in the text."
"$\mathbf{v}_{p}$, $\mathbf{v}_{r}$, and $\mathbf{v}_{e}$ are variables representing entity and relation embeddings in the TransE model described in the text."
"$\mathbf{v}_{p}$, $\mathbf{v}_{r}$, and $\mathbf{v}_{e}$ are variables representing entity and relation embeddings in the TransE model described in the text."

Linked WikiText-2 is a dataset that links articles from the WikiText-2 language modeling corpus to the Wikidata knowledge graph, providing a resource for training language models that incorporate factual knowledge from a knowledge graph.
"Ueberla, 1994 is a reference to a study or paper cited in the context of comparing models that accurately model rare tokens."

"The local knowledge graph contains all facts involving entities that have appeared in the context and grows with new entities and facts."
"$x_{t}$ represents the random variable for the next token in a sequence, which the language model aims to predict."
"$\mathcal{E}$ represents the set of entities in a knowledge graph."
"$\mathcal{R}$ represents the set of relations in a knowledge graph."
"$\kappa g$ represents the knowledge graph, which is a directed, labeled graph consisting of entities and relations."
"$\mathcal{E}_{<t}$ represents the subset of entities mentioned in the sequence of observed tokens up to $t$."

"$p_{t}$ represents the parent entity in the local knowledge graph."

entities.description: "ENTITYNLM is a knowledge-based language model that improves a language model’s ability to track entities by jointly modeling named entity recognition and coreference."
"NKLM is a neural knowledge language model that established the idea of leveraging knowledge graphs in neural language models."
"AWDLSTM is a model that has been improved upon to enhance performance on Wikitext2, and is used as a benchmark in this work."
"KGLM is the knowledge graph language model proposed in this work, which can access an external source of facts to generate text."
"Linked WikiText2 is an event where text has been aligned to facts in the knowledge graph, allowing efficient training of the model."

"Ahn et al., 2016 are the authors of NKLM, the neural knowledge language model that leverages knowledge graphs in neural language models."
"Reiter and Dale (1997) are authors of a survey of early non-neural text generation methods."
"Wiseman et al., 2017 applied recent neural methods to generating text from tables of sports statistics."
"Yang et al., 2017 worked on generating text from lists and tables."
"Lebret et al., 2016 focused on generating text from Wikipedia info-boxes."

"Yang et al., 2018 also proposed modifications to the AWDLSTM to improve performance on Wikitext2."

relationships.description: "ENTITYNLM and KGLM are related as both are knowledge-based language models, with KGLM improving upon ENTITYNLM's approach."
"NKLM and KGLM are related as both leverage knowledge graphs, but KGLM operates on an entire knowledge graph while NKLM operates on a smaller set of predefined edges."
"KGLM improves upon AWDLSTM, and it is expected that using KGLM in conjunction with methods compatible with AWDLSTM will yield further improvement."
